text: The 1876–1877 season was the sixth season of competitive football in England. ==National team== {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents !Score !England scorers !Scotland scorers |- |3 March 1877 |Kennington Oval, London | |1–3 |Alfred Lyttelton (Cambridge University) (55 mins) |John Ferguson(2), James Richmond |} Once again England played Scotland at the Kennington OvalEngland v Scotland, 3 March 1877. 11v11.com. Retrieved 27 June 2013. Archived 2013-06-30.This was England's first defeat on 'home soil'. The referee for this match was former England player, Robert Ogilvie.Report on England v Scotland match. London Hearts Supporters Club. Retrieved 18 June 2013 ==Honours== {| class="wikitable" |- !Competition !Winner |- |FA Cup||Wanderers (4*) |} Notes = Number in parentheses is the times that club has won that honour. * indicates new record for competition ==References== ==External links== *
title: 1876–77 in English football
